reference.title: Frequently Asked Questions
reference.shortdesc: Frequently asked questions about the upgrade.

section.title: Do I need to re-tag my site to use marketing reports and analytics?
section.p: No, with the exception of your video implementation. If you are not tracking video, there is no need to update your JavaScript or other AppMeasurement libraries.

section.title: Why do I need ad hoc analysis (Discover), if I can create segments in marketing reports?
section.p: Marketing reports are ideal for broadly disseminating data across an organization. In ad hoc analysis, you can perform deep, fast, effective analysis of online data. The two products complement each other and deliver a powerful online analytic solution.

section.title: How are data sources handled in marketing reporting and analytics?
section.p: Data sources behave differently based on the source type:

ul.li: Full processing, web log, and transaction ID data sources appear as normal. When segments are applied, the data is filtered according to the segment rules.

Standard or conversion data sources (ad campaigns, CRM, customer satisfaction, site performance, generic summary data, online purchases, leads and quotes, and offline channel data) appear in marketing reporst. However, because those data sources are not tied to visits or visitors, they are filtered out when segments are applied.
Traffic data sources (Website Usage > Traffic Data Source) do not appear in marketing reports.

section.p: You can identify whether a report suite has a traffic data source by going to Admin > Data Sources and looking for an entry showing “Type: Traffic Data Source,” like this:

section.title: How many times a day is data updated? Is the update on a batch process or real time? How real time is real time?
section.p: The Include Current Data feature provides many common metrics within minutes. Other metrics are available between 10 and 35 minutes, or between 45 and 120 minutes. Fully-processed, finalized data is typically available 45 to 120 minutes after receipt. For more details, see Include Current Data and Data Latency.
